description: The man accused of stabbing three people at a festival in Vancouver’s Chinatown two years ago has pleaded not guilty to three counts of aggravated assault. Blair Donnelly had been on unescorted leave from the B.C. Forensic Psychiatric Hospital in Coquitlam on the day of the attack.
title: Suspect in triple stabbing at 2023 Vancouver Chinatown festival pleads not guilty

description: The Catholic Church has just canonized its first saint who wore sneakers, played video games and used computer programming languages to spread the gospel.
title: The Catholic Church's 1st millennial saint was a teen who liked video games and computers

description: An RCMP officer who was seriously injured while responding to a mass stabbing in Hollow Water First Nation is set to be released from hospital.
title: More injured victims released from hospital days after Manitoba stabbing attack

description: A freight train slammed into a double-decker bus at a crossing northwest of Mexico City early Monday, killing at least 10 people and injuring more than 40, authorities said.
title: Freight train slams into a bus outside Mexico City, killing at least 10 people

description: The National Crime Agency said a 71-year-old Canadian who tried to bring cocaine worth $1.2 million into Britain is the latest example of how drug gangs are getting creative with who they use as their mules.
title: Montreal senior jailed in the U.K. for trying to smuggle cocaine inside a mobility scooter

description: Legislators toppled France's government in a confidence vote on Monday, a new crisis for Europe's second-largest economy that obliges President Emmanuel Macron to search for a fourth prime minister in 12 months.
title: What's happened to France's government? Why it collapsed and what comes next

description: RCMP have announced the arrest of three men who allegedly aided Rabih (Robby) Alkhalil in escaping from a B.C. jail in 2022. He's been on the loose ever since.
title: 3 men arrested for allegedly helping B.C. fugitive escape jail: RCMP

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney would not say Monday whether Canada will meet its climate goals under the Paris agreement by 2030, as his government faces criticism over his emission-reduction plans.
title: Carney government noncommittal about Canada meeting 2030 climate goals

description: The Transportation Safety Board of Canada (TSB) says it's launching an investigation after a WestJet flight from Toronto made a “hard landing” at an airport in the Caribbean country of St. Maarten Sunday afternoon.
title: TSB sends investigators to St. Maarten after WestJet plane makes 'hard landing' Sunday

description: Palestinian and Jewish Unity is urging the city to exclude the squad after its Canadian-Israeli co-owner described the riders as ambassadors for Israel.
title: Group urges Montreal mayor to exclude Israel cycling team from Grand Prix Cyclistes

description: President Donald Trump was loudly booed at the men’s final of the U.S. Open on Sunday, where extra security caused by his visit led to lines long enough that many people missed the start of play, even after organizers delayed it.
title: U.S. Open broadcasters were reportedly asked to censor reaction to Trump. Fans still booed

description: A federal appeals court on Monday upheld a civil jury's finding that U.S. President Donald Trump must pay $83.3 million to E. Jean Carroll for his repeated social media attacks against the longtime advice columnist after she accused him of sexual assault.
title: Appeals court upholds E. Jean Carroll's $83.3M defamation judgment against Trump

description: Doctors in Canada are calling for restrictions on betting ads during sports broadcasts. They say that even if the ads aren't directly targetting youths, kids still see them and are being set up for a future of problem gambling.
title: Young people inundated with sports betting ads that doctors warn can be harmful

description: Ariana Grande, Lady Gaga and Sabrina Carpenter won big, while Ricky Martin, Mariah Carey and Busta Rhymes received big honours at the high-energy, star-studded awards show.
title: Ariana Grande, Lady Gaga stun with big performances and wins at MTV's Video Music Awards

description: "Robber bees" hunt for dwindling resources in the late summer and early fall, but they usually only attack other beehives. So the owner of Rushing River Apiaries in Terrace, B.C., was shocked to find found thousands of the pollinators in her shop.
title: Thousands of 'robber bees' invade B.C. apiarist's shop in attempted honey heist

description: Patrick Gordon MacDonald will spend 10 years in prison for inciting hate, fear and division by calling for violence against Jews with terrorist propaganda images and videos he helped make.
title: Terror propagandist 'Dark Foreigner' sentenced to 10 years in prison

description: Rick Davies, the keyboardist and singer of Bloody Well Right and Goodbye Stranger by Supertramp, one of the most commercially successful bands of the 1970s and early '80s, has died. He was 81.
title: Rick Davies, founder and mainstay with hit band Supertramp, dead at 81

description: Montreal police say a human body part was found on Sunday afternoon in the Rivière-des-Prairies in the borough of Montréal-Nord. According to Radio-Canada sources, it was a man's head.
title: Man's head found in Montreal's Rivière-des-Prairies, Radio-Canada sources say

description: The year's second total lunar eclipse was visible across Asia and swathes of Europe and Africa on Sunday evening into Monday.
title: IN PHOTOS | 'Blood moon' total lunar eclipse wows

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney was in St. John's on Monday to announce an $80-million tariff relief fund for small and medium-sized businesses in Atlantic Canada.
title: Carney announces $80M tariff-relief fund for Atlantic Canadian businesses

description: At least 14 people have died in Nepal in violent protests against a social media shutdown by the government and alleged corruption, state-run television said.
title: At least 14 killed as Nepal government protests turn deadly

description: Police and a legal expert say driving any motorized vehicle, including a toy, without a licence and insurance is a punishable offence.
title: Man arrested after driving child-size pink Barbie Jeep through Prince George, B.C.

description: After a violent attack that left a high school student seriously injured earlier this year, the Brandon School Division is creating advisory committees in all of its schools this fall, focused on safety, inclusion and well-being.
title: After racially motivated sword attack at Manitoba school, advisory committees focus on safety and inclusion

description: Attackers opened fire at a bus stop at a busy intersection in north Jerusalem on Monday, killing five people and injuring another 12 people, according to Israeli police and emergency rescue services.
title: Shooting attack at Jerusalem bus stop kills 5 people
Charlottetown tenants say landlord pressuring them to leave, with big money being offered
'Queen of Canada' returns to court after rural Sask. raid

description: CBC News has learned that three federal government bodies didn’t complete mandatory privacy safeguard checks prior to implementing its $68-million project to revamp Canada's asylum system. The program was shut down quietly last year, partially complete, but experts say a lack of timely privacy tests may be putting vulnerable people’s data at risk.
title: Federal agencies fumble privacy safeguards on asylum system revamp, risking refugee data

description: Things don’t look good for Quebec premier Francois Legault and his party. Will he turn it around or will his separatist rivals stage a comeback?
title: Is it over for Quebec's Francois Legault?

description: How much would you be willing, and able, to pay to get your knee or hip replaced? Calgarian Linda Slater's knee pain became unbearable during her two-year wait to see an orthopedic surgeon, so she drained her retirement savings to pay $33,000 for a new knee at a private Toronto clinic and travel expenses.
title: Why some Canadians are using their savings, GoFundMe to pay for private surgeries
